snippet: Seven Marines and four soldiers were in a UH-60 Blackhawk helicopter conducting a training mission when the aircraft went down in a blanket of fog, officials said.
abstract: Seven Marines and four National Guard soldiers aboard UH-60 Blackhawk Army helicopter are presumed dead after it crashes in fog over Santa Rosa Sound in northwest Florida; mangled metal and human remains wash ashore.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Lizette Alvarez from Miami; Kalyn Wolfe from Navarre, Fla.; Alan Blinder from Jacksonville, N.C.; and David Thier from Hammond, La.

lead_paragraph: Seven Marines and four soldiers were in a UH-60 Blackhawk helicopter conducting a training mission when the aircraft went down in a blanket of fog, officials said.

headline.main: 11 Are Presumed Dead in Army Helicopter Crash as Mangled Metal Washes Ashore
headline.print_headline: 11 Are Presumed Dead in Army Helicopter Crash as Mangled Metal Washes Ashore
